original: thams cad du yang ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma sa ga ni nor chud mi za ba yin bden no zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
analyzed: thams cad du yang ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma sa ga ni nor chud mi za ba yin bden no zhes sgra grags par gyur to //
translated: Everywhere it was said, “It is true that Śṛṅgabara, the mother of Mṛgāra, does not waste her wealth.”

original: dge slong gis kun dga'i ra bar gtogs par sre mo lta bu rkyal bu de na ra dag gis gang ba zhig lhung ba mthong nas phyogs der mi zhig 'ongs pa dang / dge slong des mi de la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gis kun dga'i ra bar gtogs par sre mo lta bu rkyal bu de na ra dag gis gang ba zhig lhung ba mthong nas phyogs der mi zhig 'ongs pa dang / dge slong des mi de la smras pa /
translated: A monk saw a bag of money like a cat, full of coins, fallen in the pleasure grove. A man came to that place, and the monk said to that man,

original: kye nang rje sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu 'di khyod kyi ma yin nam /
analyzed: kye nang rje sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu 'di khyod kyi ma yin nam /
translated: “Hey, sir, is this bag of money like a cat yours?”

original: 'phags pa lags so //
analyzed: 'phags pa lags so //
translated: “Noble one, it is.”

original: khyer te song zhig /
analyzed: khyer te song zhig /
translated: “Take it and go.”

original: des de khyer te myur ba myur bar song ba dang / mi gzhan zhig mgo rdul gyis gang ste ngu zhing 'ongs nas des smras pa /
analyzed: des de khyer te myur ba myur bar song ba dang / mi gzhan zhig mgo rdul gyis gang ste ngu zhing 'ongs nas des smras pa /
translated: He took it and went quickly, and another man came, his head covered with dust, crying. He said,

original: 'phags pa khyod kyis sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu zhig gzigs sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyis sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu zhig gzigs sam /
translated: “Noble one, did you see a bag of money like a cat?”

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: mi zhig gis khyer te song ngo //
analyzed: mi zhig gis khyer te song ngo //
translated: “A man took it and went.”

original: des sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu de ma rnyed pa na smyos shing sems 'khrugs pas de dang der tshol ba na tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu de ma rnyed pa na smyos shing sems 'khrugs pas de dang der tshol ba na tshul ma yin pas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin du gya @355b tshom du smra bar mi bya bar de la sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu ci 'dra ba zhig srang du ba zhig ces dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gya @355b tshom du smra bar mi bya bar de la sre mo lta bu'i rkyal bu ci 'dra ba zhig srang du ba zhig ces dri bar bya'o //
translated: “In the same way, one should not speak at random. One should ask, ‘What does the bag that resembles a mongoose look like? What is its weight?’

original: gal te rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If he describes the signs correctly, it should be given to him.

original: gal te rtags la ma bab par sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rtags la ma bab par sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If he does not describe the signs correctly, the medicine should not be given to him.”

original: de dag gis de der bor te dong ba na de gzhan dag gis brkus nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de der bor te dong ba na de gzhan dag gis brkus nas /
translated: They left it there and went away. It was stolen by others.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de bzhin du bor te 'dong bar mi bya bar 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su sa'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yog par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bor te 'dong bar mi bya bar 'gro ba'i lam g-yogs su sa'am lo ma'i tshogs dag gis g-yog par bya'o //
translated: “In the same way, one should not leave it and go away. One should cover the path one is going on with grass or a pile of leaves.”

original: de dag gis de yal ba kho nar bor nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de yal ba kho nar bor nas /
translated: They simply abandoned it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de yal bar dor bar mi bya bar zhag bdun nam brgyad du der song ste bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yal bar dor bar mi bya bar zhag bdun nam brgyad du der song ste bsdad par bya'o //
translated: “You should not abandon it. You should stay there for seven or eight days.

original: gal te bdag po 'ongs shing rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag po 'ongs shing rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the owner comes and speaks in a way that is consistent with the evidence, you should give it to him.

original: gal te ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du bcug ste gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi mdzod du bcug ste gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If he does not come, then you should put it in the Sangha’s storehouse and keep it there.

original: gal te bdag bo zla ba drug 'das nas 'ongs shing rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bdag bo zla ba drug 'das nas 'ongs shing rtags la bab par smra na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If the owner comes after six months have passed and speaks in a way that is consistent with the evidence, you should give it to him.

original: gal te ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu dngos po brtan por btsongs te gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs na de'i 'og tu dngos po brtan por btsongs te gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If he does not come, then you should sell it and make it into a stable possession.

original: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na de la de dngos po 'dir btsongs kyi /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe bdag po 'ongs par gyur na de la de dngos po 'dir btsongs kyi /
translated: If the owner comes at that time, you should tell him, ‘This thing of yours was sold here.

original: rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar gyis shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Rejoice in it!’

original: gal te rjes su yi rang na de lta na legs /
analyzed: gal te rjes su yi rang na de lta na legs /
translated: If he rejoices, good.

original: gal te rjes su yi rang bar mi byed na sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rjes su yi rang bar mi byed na sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If he does not rejoice, then give it.🔽If he asks for more, say, “Don’t you think that those whom I have supported are more kind?”

original: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyangs pa gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam /khyer te song zhig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skyed slong na kho bo cag gis yongs su bskyangs pa gang yin pa de nyid drin che bar mi sems sam /khyer te song zhig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: “Take it and go.”

original: de lta bas na kun dga'i ra bar @356a *//
analyzed: de lta bas na kun dga'i ra bar @356a *//
translated: Therefore, it is not an offense for a monk to accept gold and so on if he is in a pleasure grove or in a temple.

original: gtogs pa na 'dug pa'am gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gtogs pa na 'dug pa'am gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs so //
translated: But it is an offense if he is in a monastery or in a monk’s cell.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang / de'i shas che ba dang / de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training, spoke in a way that accorded with, was similar to, and appropriate for the Dharma talk he had given to the monks.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the previous rule was limited, but this is permitted.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon bar bya ste /🔽yang dge slong gang rin po che'am /🔽rin po cher smos pa rang gi lag gis len tam len du 'jud na kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon bar bya ste / yang dge slong gang rin po che'am / rin po cher smos pa rang gi lag gis len tam len du 'jud na kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa'am /
translated: “My śrāvakas should recite this training rule:

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs te ltung byed do //🔽dge slong gis kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa'am /🔽gnas khang du gtogs pa na rin po che'am /
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa ma gtogs te ltung byed do // dge slong gis kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa'am / gnas khang du gtogs pa na rin po che'am /
translated: ‘If a monk with his own hands takes up precious things or what is classed as precious, or has it taken up, except in an enclosed dwelling or a dwelling place, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: rin po cher smos pa 'dug pa la 'di su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa 'dug pa la 'di su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis blang bar bya ste /
translated: A monk may take up precious things or what is classed as precious that are in an enclosed dwelling or a dwelling place, thinking, “Whatever this belongs to, that one will take it up.”

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no //
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no //
translated: This is the proper conduct in this matter.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde'am gzhan yang de lta bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‘A monk’: this refers to the group of six or any other monk.

original: rin po che'am zhes bya ba la rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor bu dag dang mu tig dag dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang gser dang dngul dang / rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang / @356b g-yas su 'khyil ba'o //
analyzed: rin po che'am zhes bya ba la rin po che zhes bya ba ni nor bu dag dang mu tig dag dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang gser dang dngul dang / rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang / @356b g-yas su 'khyil ba'o //
translated: Precious things means jewels, pearls, beryl, crystal, coral, gold, silver, red pearls, right-spiraling conches, and moonstones.

original: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba la rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba la rin po cher smos pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Precious things means

original: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i mtshon cha thams cad dang rol mor spyad pa'i yo byad thams cad do //
analyzed: g-yul ngor spyad pa'i mtshon cha thams cad dang rol mor spyad pa'i yo byad thams cad do //
translated: all weapons used in battle and all instruments used for entertainment.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag par ro //
translated: With one’s own hands means with one’s own hands.

original: len tam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: len tam zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: Takes means takes oneself.

original: len du 'jud na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //🔽kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol na'o //
analyzed: len du 'jud na zhes bya ba ni gzhan no // kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni kun dga' ra ba'i phyi rol na'o //
translated: Causes to take means causes another to take.🔽In a monastery means outside the monastery.

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra ba'i nang na'o //
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra ba'i nang na'o //
translated: In a dwelling means inside the monastery.

original: ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa 'am /
analyzed: ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa na 'dug pa 'am /
translated: “Except” means that if it is in the vicinity of a pleasure grove or

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa na bzhag ste'o //
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na 'dug pa na bzhag ste'o //
translated: in the vicinity of a dwelling, it may be left there.🔽“Offense” means that one will be burned, cooked, and fall into the lower realms,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: the bad destinies, the lower births, the hells, the animal realm, and the

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: realm of hungry ghosts.🔽Moreover, as long as that offense is not confessed and does not go away,

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: it obscures virtuous qualities.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so /
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni chos 'di pas so //
translated: “A monk” means a follower of this doctrine.

original: kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: kun dga'i ra bar gtogs pa'am /
translated: “In the vicinity of a pleasure grove” or

original: gnas khang du gtogs pa na rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa 'dug pa la 'di su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnas khang du gtogs pa na rin po che'am rin po cher smos pa 'dug pa la 'di su'i yin pa de len par 'gyur grang snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis blang bar bya ste /
translated: “in the vicinity of a dwelling” means that if a precious thing or something considered precious is left there, one may pick it up with the thought, “Whoever this belongs to will take it back.”

original: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba la de la de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //🔽de la ltung ba ji @357a *//
analyzed: de la de ni cho ga yin no zhes bya ba la de la de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o // de la ltung ba ji @357a *//
translated: “That is the procedure” means that is the corresponding rule.

original: ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall?

original: bar sdom la /
analyzed: bar sdom la /
translated: The summary:

original: nor bu mgul rgyan pi wang dang / dung dang gzhu dang mda' dang ni //
analyzed: nor bu mgul rgyan pi wang dang / dung dang gzhu dang mda' dang ni //
translated: Gem, necklace, lute, conch, bow, arrow,

original: sku gzugs sku gdung bcas pa dang // sngon gyi tshul ni tha ma yin //🔽dge slong gis nor bu len na bdar ba len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: sku gzugs sku gdung bcas pa dang // sngon gyi tshul ni tha ma yin // dge slong gis nor bu len na bdar ba len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: image, relic, and finally, former way.

original: ma bdar ba len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma bdar ba len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes a gem, he commits a minor offense if he takes one that is not polished, and a downfall if he takes one that is polished.

original: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mu tig dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu ji lta ba bzhin du mu tig dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang rdo'i snying po dang / spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with gems, the same applies to pearls, lapis lazuli, crystal, coral, silver, gold, onyx, ruby, and right-spiraling conches.

original: tha na nor bu mching bu len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na nor bu mching bu len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes a glass gem, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis mgul rgyan len na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis mgul rgyan len na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk takes a necklace, he commits a minor offense.

original: mgul rgyan ji lta ba bzhin du gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang ngo shal dang sen mo do yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mgul rgyan ji lta ba bzhin du gdu bu rgyan can dang dpung rgyan dang ngo shal dang sen mo do yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with a necklace, so with bracelets, armlets, necklaces, and finger rings.

original: tha na sog ma'i phreng ba len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na sog ma'i phreng ba len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes a straw ring, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis pi wang len na rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis pi wang len na rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk plays a lute, he commits an offense entailing suspension if he plays with the strings,

original: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: but an offense of wrong conduct if he plays without the strings.

original: pi wang ji lta ba de bzhin du 'od ma dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang su gho sha ka yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: pi wang ji lta ba de bzhin du 'od ma dang bal la ri dang ma ha ti dang su gho sha ka yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with a lute, so with a flute, a reed instrument, a clay drum, and a string instrument.

original: tha na mchu sbrang len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na mchu sbrang len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes a mouth organ, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis dung len na sgra 'byin pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis dung len na sgra 'byin pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk plays a conch, he commits an offense entailing suspension if he plays with a sound,

original: sgra mi 'byin pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra mi 'byin pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: but an offense of wrong conduct if he plays without a sound.

original: dung ji lta ba bzhin du rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dung ji lta ba bzhin du rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rdza rnga yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with a conch, so with a big drum, a kettledrum, and a small kettledrum.

original: tha na rdza rnga kha cig pa len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na rdza rnga kha cig pa len na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes up a single-sided clay drum, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis @357b gzhu len na rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis @357b gzhu len na rgyud dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk takes up a bow, he commits an offense entailing suspension if he takes it up with a string;

original: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if he takes it up without a string, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gzhu ji lta ba bzhin du ral gri dang ral gri khyog po dang ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang 'phang mdung dang lcags kyo yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhu ji lta ba bzhin du ral gri dang ral gri khyog po dang ral gri so gnyis pa dang / mdung dang 'phang mdung dang lcags kyo yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to a sword, a curved knife, a double-edged knife, a spear, a javelin, and an iron bar.

original: tha na gzhu len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na gzhu len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes up a toy bow, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis mda' len na mde'u dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis mda' len na mde'u dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk takes up an arrow, he commits an offense entailing suspension if he takes it up with a shaft;

original: mde'u med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mde'u med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if he takes it up without a shaft, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: mda' ji lta ba bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mda' ji lta ba bzhin du lcags mda' dang / mda' phyed lcags las byas pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to an iron arrow and a half-iron arrow.

original: tha na mda' ltar bcos pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na mda' ltar bcos pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he takes up a toy arrow, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis sku gzugs len na sku gdung dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis sku gzugs len na sku gdung dang bcas pa len na ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: If a monk takes a statue, but it has relics, he commits an offense.

original: sku gdung med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku gdung med pa len na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not have relics, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag ste len na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ston pa'i 'du shes nye bar bzhag ste len na ltung ba med do //

original: de lta bas na lam gyi dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na lam gyi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I allow you to bathe when it is the time for the road.”

original: rlung byung nas dge slong dag rdul gyis rdul can du gyur nas de dag kho na bzhin du 'khod pa na /
analyzed: rlung byung nas dge slong dag rdul gyis rdul can du gyur nas de dag kho na bzhin du 'khod pa na /

analyzed: bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag 'ongs nas de dag gis mthong nas dris pa /

analyzed: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du rdul gyis gos shing bzhugs /

original: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
analyzed: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
translated: “What is wrong with bathing?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo //
translated: “The Blessed One has not allowed it.”

original: zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: de lta bas na rlung gi dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rlung gi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, I allow you to bathe when it is the time for the wind.”

original: char 'bab nas dge slong dag mngon par lngar nas de dag kho na bzhin du 'khod pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te dris pa /

analyzed: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du char gyis mngon par lngar cing bzhugs /
translated: “Noble ones, why are you staying outside in the rain?”

original: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
analyzed: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
translated: “Why don’t you bathe?”🔽“The Blessed One has not allowed it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, who said,

original: de lta bas na char gyi dus ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na char gyi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Monks, I allow you to bathe when it rains, except during the rainy season.”🔽It rained and the monks remained outside.

original: rdzi char byung nas dge slong dag lus khra bor gyur nas de dag de kho na bzhin du 'khod pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te dris pa /
analyzed: rdzi char byung nas dge slong dag lus khra bor gyur nas de dag de kho na bzhin du 'khod pa dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gtsug lag khang du 'ongs te dris pa /
translated: When the faithful brahmins and householders came to the monastery and asked,

original: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du @363b lus khra bor gyur cing bzhugs /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du @363b lus khra bor gyur cing bzhugs /
translated: “Noble ones, why are you staying outside in the rain?”

original: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
analyzed: khrus mdzad na ci nongs /
translated: “Why don’t you bathe?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma gnang ngo zhes zer ba'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: de lta bas na rdzi char gyi dus ma gtogs so //
translated: “Therefore, except during the rainy season, it is not to be done.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having praised the desire for training, respect for training, and the austerity of training,

original: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la de dang mthun pa dang de'i shas che ba dang de dang 'tsham pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i bka' mchid mdzad nas /
translated: spoke in praise of the Dharma that is in harmony with that, is of the same kind, and is of the same category as that.

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag de bas na snga ma bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de bas na snga ma bcas pa yin la 'di ni gnang ba yin te /
translated: “Monks, therefore, the former is a rule, but this is an exception.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste bcom ldan 'das kyis zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa de las 'dums par byed na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste bcom ldan 'das kyis zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa de las 'dums par byed na dus ma gtogs te ltung byed do //
translated: My disciples should recite this rule for training: ‘If a monk bathes more often than that, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: The appropriate occasions:🔽the two and a half months of the hot season,🔽the first month of the rainy season,

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so //🔽lhag ma ni na ba dus so //
analyzed: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so // lhag ma ni na ba dus so //
translated: when one is sick,

original: las dus so //
analyzed: las dus so //
translated: when one has building work,

original: lam dus so //🔽rlung dus so //🔽char dus so //
analyzed: lam dus so // rlung dus so // char dus so //
translated: when one is traveling,🔽when there is wind,

original: rdzi char dus te /
analyzed: rdzi char dus te /
translated: when there is rain,🔽and when there is a dust storm.

original: de la de ni dus yin no //
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis so //
translated: The Blessed One: the Buddha, the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba ngo phyed @364a *//
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing khrus bya bar gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni zla ba ngo phyed @364a *//
translated: Bathing more often than that: every half-month.

original: phyed la'o // de las 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed phyed las 'dums par byed na'o //
analyzed: phyed la'o // de las 'dums par byed na zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed phyed las 'dums par byed na'o //
translated: If he reduces it from that, he reduces it from half a month.🔽Except in a time of danger.

original: dus ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni dus bzhag ste'o //🔽ltung byed do //🔽zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /

translated: A downfall.

original: 'tshod par byed /🔽ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshod par byed / ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: It burns, it scalds, it brings down—into the realms of hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts, into the lower realms, into bad rebirths.

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste des na ltung byed do //
translated: It obscures virtuous qualities for as long as one does not confess and does not reveal the downfall.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is why it is called a downfall.

original: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dus ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the time of danger:

original: so ka rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis dang / dbyar rnams kyi dang po dang zla ba phyed dang gsum po 'di dag ni tsha ba'i dus so zhes bya ba la /

translated: The remaining one and a half months of summer, the first month of the rainy season, and the first half of the second month of the rainy season—these are the three and a half months of the hot season.

original: so ga rnams kyi zla ba lhag ma phyed dang gnyis zhes bya ba ni zla ba phyed dang gnyis ni dbyar nye bar bsgrub par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /

translated: The remaining one and a half months of spring are the time for entering the rains.🔽

analyzed: las dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi'am /
translated: The remaining one and a half months of summer is the remaining one and a half months of the three

original: mchod rten gyi las tha na re lde tsam zhig phyags @364b sam dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam zhig byug pa byas na'o //🔽lam dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste dge slong dpag tshad gcig tu song ngam /

translated: It is when one sweeps even a single straw into a stupa, or when one anoints even a single square meter of a stupa’s circumambulation walkway.

original: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ong na'o //
analyzed: dpag tshad phyed du song ste phyir 'ong na'o //
translated: “The time of travel” is when one goes even a single krośa or half a krośa and returns.

original: rlung dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na rlung gis gos kyi gra bskul bar gyur na'o //
analyzed: rlung dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na rlung gis gos kyi gra bskul bar gyur na'o //
translated: “The time of wind” is when even a single corner of one’s robe is moved by the wind.

original: char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na lus la char gyi thigs pa gnyis sam /🔽gsum bab par gyur na'o //
analyzed: char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na lus la char gyi thigs pa gnyis sam / gsum bab par gyur na'o //
translated: “The time of rain” is when even two or three drops of rain fall on one’s body.

original: rdze char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na rdzi char gyis gos kyi mtha' bskul bar gyur cing lus la char pa'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
analyzed: rdze char dus so zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste tha na rdzi char gyis gos kyi mtha' bskul bar gyur cing lus la char pa'i thigs pa gnyis sam gsum bab par gyur na'o //
translated: “The time of drizzle” is when even a single corner of one’s robe is moved by the drizzle, and two or three drops of rain fall on one’s body.

original: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni de la de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la de ni dus yin no zhes bya ba ni de la de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos yin pa'o //
translated: “That is the time” means that is the appropriate Dharma.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit a downfall in this case?

original: dge slong gis dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If a fully ordained monk bathes with a consecration bath, he must do it at the right time.

original: dus byin gyis ma brlabs par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus byin gyis ma brlabs par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If he bathes at the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct as long as the water has not reached his navel.

original: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the water reaches his navel, he commits a serious violation.

original: dge slong gi 'jug pa'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi 'jug pa'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If a fully ordained monk bathes with a consecration bath, he must do it at the right time.

original: dus byin gyis ma brlabs par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dus byin gyis ma brlabs par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If he bathes at the wrong time, he commits an offense of wrong conduct as long as the water has not reached his navel.

original: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chus lte bar son na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the water reaches his navel, he commits a serious violation.

original: dge slong gis dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas 'jug pa'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dbang bskur ba'i khrus kyis khrus byas nas 'jug pa'i khrus kyis khrus byed na des dus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If a fully ordained monk bathes with a consecration bath and then bathes with a regular bath, he must do it at the right time.

original: dus byin gyis ma brlab par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su @365a *//
analyzed: dus byin gyis ma brlab par khrus byed na ji srid du chus lte bar ma son gyi bar du nyes byas su @365a *//

translated: “Causes regret” means “causes a little regret, a little remorse, a little anxiety in the mind.”

translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na bcu bdun sde dag gal te gcig la las
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa mo'u dgal gyi bu chen pos nye bar 'khor la sogs pa sar pa skyes phran gzhon nu bcu bdun sde'i tshogs dag rab tu phyung rdzogs par bsnyen par byas pa de'i tshe na bcu bdun sde dag gal te gcig la las
translated: When the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana gave the going forth and the monastic ordination to the group of seventeen young men, headed by Upāli, at that time the group of seventeen would, if one of them

original: su bsko ba bab pa na yang de dag thams cad bsdongs te byed do //
analyzed: su bsko ba bab pa na yang de dag thams cad bsdongs te byed do //
translated: was appointed to a task, all gather together and do it.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na gtsug lag khang der mtshan thog thag tu chos mnyan pa byung ba der de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so //🔽phyi de nyin par dge 'dun @376a *//
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na gtsug lag khang der mtshan thog thag tu chos mnyan pa byung ba der de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so // phyi de nyin par dge 'dun @376a *//
translated: Once, when there was a Dharma discourse in the monastery all night, they all gathered together and attended to it.

original: gyi sro khang du chos mnyan pa byung nas der yang de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so //
analyzed: gyi sro khang du chos mnyan pa byung nas der yang de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so //
translated: The next day, when there was a Dharma discourse in the assembly hall of the Saṅgha, they all gathered together and attended to it.

original: de'i phyi de nyin par bcu bdun sde las gcig la dge skos phab nas de'i nyin mo yang thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang brgyan te 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyin par bcu bdun sde las gcig la dge skos phab nas de'i nyin mo yang thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang brgyan te 'khod do //
translated: The next day, when one of the group of seventeen was appointed as the monk in charge of assigning duties, on that day they all gathered together and attended to the monastery.

original: de nas dge skos tron byed pa'i tshe bcu bdun sde las gcig la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //
analyzed: de nas dge skos tron byed pa'i tshe bcu bdun sde las gcig la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //
translated: Then, when it was time for the monk in charge of the storehouse to open it, one of the seventeen thought, “I’m tired. I’ll sleep.”

original: mi bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
analyzed: mi bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
translated: The other sixteen thought, “Why should we open the storehouse?”

original: de de bzhin du re re la yang blo de lta bu de lta bu byung nas gzhan bcu drug po thams cad so sor nyal du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: de de bzhin du re re la yang blo de lta bu de lta bu byung nas gzhan bcu drug po thams cad so sor nyal du 'dong ngo //
translated: In the same way, each of them thought, “I’m tired,” and they all went off to sleep.

original: dge skos 'ba' zhig gcig pus mtshan thog thag las byas te mtshan mo nam nangs pa dang mar me'i kong bu dag bsdus /
analyzed: dge skos 'ba' zhig gcig pus mtshan thog thag las byas te mtshan mo nam nangs pa dang mar me'i kong bu dag bsdus /
translated: The monk in charge of the storehouse worked all night by himself. In the morning, he collected the oil lamps,

original: sgo dag phye /
analyzed: sgo dag phye /
translated: opened the doors,

original: gtsug lag khang chag chag btab /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang chag chag btab /
translated: swept the temple,

original: byug pa byas te dus shes par byas nas stan bshams shing mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims te gtsug lag khang gi steng du 'greng nas gand'i brdungs par brtsams so //
analyzed: byug pa byas te dus shes par byas nas stan bshams shing mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims te gtsug lag khang gi steng du 'greng nas gand'i brdungs par brtsams so //
translated: and anointed it. He set out the seats, lit incense in the courtyard of the stūpa, and stood in the temple. He began to beat the gandi.

original: de nas bcu drug po de dag gand'i de'i sgras sad nas rang rang gi gnas khang dag nas lhung bzed thogs te byung ba dang / de dag gis dge skos de gcig pu phar rgyug tshur rgyug cing 'dug pa mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas bcu drug po de dag gand'i de'i sgras sad nas rang rang gi gnas khang dag nas lhung bzed thogs te byung ba dang / de dag gis dge skos de gcig pu phar rgyug tshur rgyug cing 'dug pa mthong nas /
translated: They saw the monk in charge of the temple running back and forth by himself.

original: de dag gis phan tshun smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis phan tshun smras pa /
translated: They said to each other,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di gcig pu phar rgyug tshur rgyug cing 'dug na yu bu cag las sus kyang 'di'i grogs ma byas sam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di gcig pu phar rgyug tshur rgyug cing 'dug na yu bu cag las sus kyang 'di'i grogs ma byas sam /
translated: “Venerable ones, he is running back and forth by himself. Has no one helped him?”

original: gcig gis smras pa /
analyzed: gcig gis smras pa /
translated: One said,

original: kho bo la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //
analyzed: kho bo la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //
translated: “I thought, ‘I’m tired. I’ll sleep.’

original: mi @376b bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
analyzed: mi @376b bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
translated: I wondered, ‘Why can’t the sixteen of us help him?’”

original: de bzhin du gzhan de skad zer /🔽gzhan dag kyang de skad zer te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan de skad zer / gzhan dag kyang de skad zer te /
translated: The others said the same thing.

original: thams cad kyis de skad smras so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis de skad smras so //
translated: They all said the same thing.

original: de nas bcu drug po dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bcu drug po dag gis smras pa /
translated: Then the sixteen said,🔽“

original: tshe dang ldan ba dag 'di bdag cag gi 'phral gyi bya ba thams cad la thog mar 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan ba dag 'di bdag cag gi 'phral gyi bya ba thams cad la thog mar 'gro ba yin na /
translated: “Venerables, he is the one who always goes first in all our activities.

original: bdag cag gis 'di'i grogs ma byas pa yin na ni /
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di'i grogs ma byas pa yin na ni /
translated: If we do not help him,

original: yu bu cag gi ma legs pa byas te 'di bdag cag la gshe bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yu bu cag gi ma legs pa byas te 'di bdag cag la gshe bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: it will not be good for us, and he will scold us.🔽As soon as we finish eating, we will ask for his forgiveness.”

original: zan zos ma thag tu gzod pa gsol par bya'o zhes de dag gis zan zos nas bzod pa gsol bar brtsams te /
analyzed: zan zos ma thag tu gzod pa gsol par bya'o zhes de dag gis zan zos nas bzod pa gsol bar brtsams te /
translated: After they finished eating, they began to ask for his forgiveness.

original: gzhon pa rnams kyis ni de'i rkang pa la gtugs /
analyzed: gzhon pa rnams kyis ni de'i rkang pa la gtugs /
translated: The younger monks touched his feet,

original: rgan pa rnams kyis ni mgul nas 'khyud de /
analyzed: rgan pa rnams kyis ni mgul nas 'khyud de /
translated: while the older monks embraced him.

original: tshe dang ldan pa bzod pa gsol lo zhes byas na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bzod pa gsol lo zhes byas na /
translated: “Venerable, we ask for your forgiveness.”

original: de cang mi smra ba nyid du 'dug go /
analyzed: de cang mi smra ba nyid du 'dug go /
translated: But he remained silent.

original: de dang ches bshes pa gcig yod pa des ga ga tshil byas pa dang des dgod par brtsams te /
analyzed: de dang ches bshes pa gcig yod pa des ga ga tshil byas pa dang des dgod par brtsams te /
translated: One of his close friends broke wind, and he began to laugh.

original: bzod do zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: bzod do zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: “I forgive you,” he said.

original: de dag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa /
translated: They thought,

original: de ni thabs legs pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: de ni thabs legs pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: “That’s a good idea.”

original: gzhan gyis kyang ga ga tshil byas shing /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ga ga tshil byas shing /
translated: So others broke wind,

original: de bzhin du thams cad kyi bar gyis ga ga tshil byas pa dang de rlung gyen du 'chugs te dus la bab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad kyi bar gyis ga ga tshil byas pa dang de rlung gyen du 'chugs te dus la bab bo //
translated: In the same way, they all began to scratch themselves, and the wind blew the lice into the opening.🔽They began to cry and lament,

original: de dag brtad cing mya ngan bya bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag brtad cing mya ngan bya bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: and the monks asked them,

original: kye bcu bdun sde dag ci'i phyir brtad cing mya ngan byed /
analyzed: kye bcu bdun sde dag ci'i phyir brtad cing mya ngan byed /
translated: “Hey, Group-of-Seventeen, why are you crying and lamenting?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽🔽

original: bdag cag sngon ni na bcu bdun sder gyur nad ni bcu drug sder 'gyur te /🔽tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yid du 'ong ba dang bral zhing pham par 'gyur ba'i @377a *//
analyzed: bdag cag sngon ni na bcu bdun sder gyur nad ni bcu drug sder 'gyur te / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yid du 'ong ba dang bral zhing pham par 'gyur ba'i @377a *//
translated: Formerly we were the Group-of-Seventeen, but now we’ve become the Group-of-Sixteen.

original: ltung ba byung ngo //
analyzed: ltung ba byung ngo //
translated: We’ve lost our attractive fellow practitioners, and we’ve incurred a defeating offense.🔽”

original: dge slong de dag gis ma legs so zhes smras te 'dong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis ma legs so zhes smras te 'dong ngo //
translated: The monks said, “That’s not good,” and left.

original: bcu drug po de dag kyang mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa de dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong nas de dge slong de dag gis sbyor ba brtsams te tshe dang ldan bcu bdun sde 'di dag ni sog ma'i me bzhin du skad
analyzed: bcu drug po de dag kyang mtha' gcig tu dong ste sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa de dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong nas de dge slong de dag gis sbyor ba brtsams te tshe dang ldan bcu bdun sde 'di dag ni sog ma'i me bzhin du skad
translated: The other monks saw the group of seventeen sitting in silence, and they said, “Venerables, the group of seventeen is like a fire of straw.

original: cig gis 'bar zhing skad cig gis shi bar gyur te yud tsam zhig gis rgod bag byed cing yud tsam zhig gis sems khong du chud cing 'khod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: cig gis 'bar zhing skad cig gis shi bar gyur te yud tsam zhig gis rgod bag byed cing yud tsam zhig gis sems khong du chud cing 'khod do zhes zer ro //
translated: They flare up in an instant and die down in an instant. They are boisterous for a moment and then sit in silence.”

original: de dag mya ngan gyi mes yid gdungs pas yongs su spyos kyang cang mi smra bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
analyzed: de dag mya ngan gyi mes yid gdungs pas yongs su spyos kyang cang mi smra bar sems khong du chud cing 'khod do //
translated: They were tormented by the fire of grief, but they did not say anything. They sat in silence.

original: de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa 'char ka sa mthong nas /
analyzed: de dag sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa 'char ka sa mthong nas /
translated: Udayin saw them sitting in silence.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He asked, “

original: bcu bdun sde dag ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag ci'i phyir sems khong du chud cing 'khod /
translated: Why are the group of seventeen sitting in silence?”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said, “

original: kho bo cag da dung bcu bdun sde yin snyam mam /
analyzed: kho bo cag da dung bcu bdun sde yin snyam mam /
translated: Do you think we are still the group of seventeen?”

original: ci'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Why not?🔽When they explained the situation in detail, some monks with few desires complained, “Why do monks make itching noises with their fingers on other monks?”

original: de dag gis skabs de rgyas par brjod pa na dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong la sor mos ga ga tshil byed ces smod par byed /
analyzed: de dag gis skabs de rgyas par brjod pa na dge slong don nyung ngu dag ci'i phyir dge slong dag dge slong la sor mos ga ga tshil byed ces smod par byed /
translated: They criticized them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs te dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs te dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Then the Blessed One, for this reason, for this cause, on this occasion, convened a gathering of the community of monks.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni @377b mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni @377b mkhyen bzhin du rmed par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The buddhas, the blessed ones, know what is happening and ask about it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The rest is the same as before.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa /🔽dge slong dag sor mos ga ga tshil byed pa bden nam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa / dge slong dag sor mos ga ga tshil byed pa bden nam /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, questioned the group of seventeen:

original: btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Monks, is it true that you make itching noises with your fingers?”🔽“Yes, it’s true, ” they replied.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, rebuked them, saying,🔽“Monks, this is not in accordance with the Dharma, it is not in accordance with the monastic code, it is not in accordance with the training, and it is not suitable for a renunciant.

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: A renunciant should not do this.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having rebuked them in many ways, addressed the monks, saying,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Monks, for these ten benefits I have seen, I lay down the training rules for the hearers in the monastic code. And so on, as before.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: My hearers, the training rules in the monastic code should be recited like this:

original: sor mos ga ga tshil byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: sor mos ga ga tshil byed na ltung byed do //
translated: If one pokes one’s finger at someone, one commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: sor mos ga ga tshil byed na zhes bya ba ni sor mos ga ga tshil bya ba ni sor mos ga ga tshil bya ba'i bsam pas lus kyi las dang lus kyi spyod pa dang lus kyi g-yo ba gang yin pa byed na'o //
analyzed: sor mos ga ga tshil byed na zhes bya ba ni sor mos ga ga tshil bya ba ni sor mos ga ga tshil bya ba'i bsam pas lus kyi las dang lus kyi spyod pa dang lus kyi g-yo ba gang yin pa byed na'o //
translated: “With a finger” means with a finger. “Pointed” means pointed. “To snap” means to snap. “With the intention of snapping” means with the intention of snapping. “Whatever physical action, physical behavior, and physical movement” means whatever.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /🔽'tshod par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dvags ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed / 'tshod par byed /
translated: “Offense” means to burn,🔽to boil,

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: to fall,

original: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /
translated: and also to obstruct wholesome qualities for as long as that offense is not confessed and does not go away.

original: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called an offense.

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe @378a *//
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe @378a *//
translated: What is an offense?

original: na; dge slong gis dge slong la sor mo gcig gis ga ga tshil byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na; dge slong gis dge slong la sor mo gcig gis ga ga tshil byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk snaps his fingers at a monk, he commits an offense.

original: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lngas ga ga tshil byed na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ro; ;khu tshur dang gru mo dang phrag pa dang mgo dang glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang brla dang byin pa dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos ga ga tshil byed na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis dang gsum dang bzhi dang lngas ga ga tshil byed na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ro; ;khu tshur dang gru mo dang phrag pa dang mgo dang glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang brla dang byin pa dang / tha na rkang pa'i mthe bos ga ga tshil byed na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one claps one’s hands with one’s fist, elbow, shoulder, head, chest, back, waist, thigh, or calf, or even with one’s toe, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽There is no offense if one shows a wound;

original: rma ston pa dang / sbrang bu dang / 'brum bu dang / sme ba dang / spu'i tshangs ston pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rma ston pa dang / sbrang bu dang / 'brum bu dang / sme ba dang / spu'i tshangs ston pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if one shows a mosquito, a bee, a pimple, a birthmark, or a mole;

original: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: if one is a beginner; if one is insane; if one is the first offender;

original: ga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu gsum pa rdzogs so ////
analyzed: ga ga tshil byed pa'i ltung byed de drug cu gsum pa rdzogs so ////
translated: The rule governing clapping one’s hands is the sixty-third.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe bcu bdun sde dag las tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcu bdun sde dag las tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the Venerable Upāli abandoned all the defilements and actualized arhatship,

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: he thought,

original: bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'di dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad yod dam snyam na /
analyzed: bdag gi tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'di dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba cung zad yod dam snyam na /
translated: “Do these celibate practitioners have any roots of virtue?”

original: des yod par mthong ngo //
analyzed: des yod par mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that they did.

original: su la rag las snyam na /
analyzed: su la rag las snyam na /
translated: To whom do they belong?”🔽He saw that they belonged to himself.

original: bdag nyid la rag las par mthong nas de bcu drug po gzhan dag gdul ba la ltos pas de dag gis phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ba na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la rag las par mthong nas de bcu drug po gzhan dag gdul ba la ltos pas de dag gis phyi bzhin phyi bzhin rjes su 'brang ba na /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: 'on te chu btsag par bya /

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /

original: je chu btsag par bya ste /
analyzed: je chu btsag par bya ste /

analyzed: de'i 'og tu khrus bya'o zhes de dag gis chu btsags nas /

analyzed: gos dag mtha' gcig tu phud de khrus bya bar brtsams nas chur zhugs te de dag steng du 'byung bar yang byed /

analyzed: 'og tu nub par yang byed /

analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar yang byed /

analyzed: chu la rnga bo che'i sgra 'byin par yang byed /

analyzed: rdza rnga kha gcig pa'i sgra 'byin pa yang byed /
translated: and the sound of a single-headed drum.

analyzed: chu la gseg ma 'khrab pa dang 'phen par yang byed /

analyzed: chu la khor yug dang rdo rje lta bu yang byed / chu la khron pa dang rba klong dang / chu srubs 'dren pa yang byed /

analyzed: chu la rgod bag dang phyar g-yeng dang lus sgyur ba dag kyang byed do //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor yang shes bzhin du khrus byas te /

analyzed: chu klung gnas can rgal nas chos gos dag bgos te sdod do //

original: de'i tshe ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal steng gi khang bzang gi gzhir gtogs pa na btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang lhan cig 'dug pas ji tsam na bcu bdun sde dag chu la rtse bar rtse ba mthong ngo //

translated: At that time, King Prasenajit of Kosala was sitting in the upper palace with Queen Mālikā. They saw the group of seventeen playing in the water.

original: mthong nas kyang des btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang des btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa /
translated: Having seen them, he said to Queen Mālikā,

analyzed: phreng @379a *// ldan ma yon gnas dag gis mdzes pa la ltos shig ltos shig /
translated: “Mālikā, look at the beauty of these worthy ones playing!”🔽Mālikā said,

original: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
analyzed: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
translated: Then Maṇigrīva said, You are right.

original: lha de ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
analyzed: lha de ni ngo mtshar mi che ste /
translated: “That god is not so amazing.

original: lang tsho gsar du gyur nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa lags kyi /
analyzed: lang tsho gsar du gyur nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa lags kyi /
translated: He practiced celibacy when he was young.

analyzed: lha bgres pa'i gnas skabs su gyur kyang da dung thugs ma byung ba ngo mtshar che lags so //
translated: It is amazing that he still has not had sex even though he is now old.”

original: rgyal po skyengs nas cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
analyzed: rgyal po skyengs nas cang mi smra bar 'dug go /

original: tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis la la zhig mi dga' bar sems par ma gyur tam snyam du bsams na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor gyis la la zhig mi dga' bar sems par ma gyur tam snyam du bsams na /

analyzed: des ji tsam na ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal steng gi khang bzang gi gzhir gtogs pa na mi dga' bar sems pa mthong ngo //

original: mthong nas kyang de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang de dag la smras pa /
translated: Having seen him, he said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal mi dga' bar sems kyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal mi dga' bar sems kyi /
translated: “Venerable ones, King Prasenajit of Kosala is unhappy.

original: byung zhig dang de dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: byung zhig dang de dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Let us go and make him happy.”

original: de nas de dag byung ste gos dag gyon pa tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor mos pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag byung ste gos dag gyon pa tshe dang ldan pa nye bar 'khor mos pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas /
translated: Then they appeared, dressed in their robes. The venerable Upāli entered into concentration born of aspiration.

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad chu tshags dang chu bum dang bcas te steng gi nam mkha' la ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa ltar 'phags te 'dong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad chu tshags dang chu bum dang bcas te steng gi nam mkha' la ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang pa ltar 'phags te 'dong ngo //
translated: In this way, all of them, with their water strainers and water pots, rose up into the sky like a king of geese with outstretched wings and departed.

original: de dag steng gi nam mkha' la 'dong ba'i grib ma ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi steng gi khang bzang gi gzhir bab nas /
analyzed: de dag steng gi nam mkha' la 'dong ba'i grib ma ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyi steng gi khang bzang gi gzhir bab nas /
translated: The shadow of them going up into the sky fell on the roof of the palace of Prasenajit, king of Kosala.

original: btsun mo phreng ldan mas de dag steng gi nam mkha' la ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar 'phags te 'dong ba mthong nas /
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan mas de dag steng gi nam mkha' la ngang pa'i rgyal po 'dab ma brkyang ba ltar 'phags te 'dong ba mthong nas /

original: des ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po @379b gsal rgyal la smras pa /
analyzed: des ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po @379b gsal rgyal la smras pa /
translated: She said to Prasenajit, king of Kosala,

original: lha yon gnas dag gi mdzes pa la gzigs shig gzigs shig /
analyzed: lha yon gnas dag gi mdzes pa la gzigs shig gzigs shig /
translated: “Your Majesty, look at the beauty of the worthy ones! Look!”🔽The king said,

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,🔽🔽

original: phreng ldan ma dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa dag chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: phreng ldan ma dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa dag chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar 'gyur ba de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te de ni gnas med do //
translated: “An arhat bhikṣuṇī, who has exhausted the defilements, playing in the water like this, is not possible, is not an opportunity. It is impossible.

original: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
analyzed: phreng ldan mas smras pa /
translated: “Mālikā said,

original: lhas de ni gsan na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di na ngas dge slong 'dug pa na 'dod chags dang bcas zhe sdang dang bcas gti mug dang bcas par mthong la /
analyzed: lhas de ni gsan na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di na ngas dge slong 'dug pa na 'dod chags dang bcas zhe sdang dang bcas gti mug dang bcas par mthong la /
translated: “If the king listens to this, the Bhagavān said, ‘Here, I see a bhikṣu sitting with attachment, with aversion, and with delusion.

original: de nyid langs pa na /
analyzed: de nyid langs pa na /
translated: When he gets up,

original: 'dod chags dang bral zhe sdang dang bral gti mug dang bral bar yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral zhe sdang dang bral gti mug dang bral bar yang mthong ngo //
translated: I see him free from attachment, free from aversion, and free from delusion.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na sems ni glog dang 'dra la /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na sems ni glog dang 'dra la /
translated: “Bhikṣus, therefore, the mind is like lightning.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje dang 'dra bas nyon mongs pa rnams ni ye shes kyis 'joms so zhes gsungs pa de ma gsan tam /

original: rgyal po thos pa nyung bas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
analyzed: rgyal po thos pa nyung bas de cang mi smra bar 'dug go /
translated: “The king, having little learning, remained silent.

original: phreng ldan mas kyang bsams pa /
analyzed: phreng ldan mas kyang bsams pa /
translated: Mālikā thought,

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa dag chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse ba de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa dag chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse ba de ni gnas ma yin skabs ma yin te /
translated: “It is not possible, it is not feasible, that the arhats whose defilements have ceased would play in the water like children.”

original: de ni gnas med do snyam mo //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do snyam mo //
translated: “This is not possible.”

original: de nas btsun mo phreng ldan mas mi zhig la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas btsun mo phreng ldan mas mi zhig la smras pa /
translated: Then Queen Mālādhara said to a man,

original: kye nang rje khyod tshur shog /
analyzed: kye nang rje khyod tshur shog /
translated: “Hey, mister, please go to the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song la phyin pa dang / kho mo'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshol la 'di skad btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i mchid nas btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar bgyis pas rgyal po glo ba mi dga' bar sems na /🔽kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis 'phags pa @380a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song la phyin pa dang / kho mo'i tshig gis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshol la 'di skad btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i mchid nas btsun pa 'phags pa 'di dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar bgyis pas rgyal po glo ba mi dga' bar sems na / kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis 'phags pa @380a *//
translated: When you arrive, bow your head at the feet of the Blessed One and say on my behalf, ‘Noble one, these noble ones are playing in the water like children, and the king is displeased.

original: dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar mi 'gyur ba dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' bar mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o zhes gsol cig /
analyzed: dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar mi 'gyur ba dran par bgyi ba cung zhig bca' bar mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o zhes gsol cig /
translated: Oh, Blessed One, it would be good if you would think of something so that the noble ones will not play in the water like children.🔽’”

original: mi des jo mo bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes btsun mo phreng ldan ma las mnyan nas /
analyzed: mi des jo mo bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes btsun mo phreng ldan ma las mnyan nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He listened to Queen Mālādhara and went to where the Blessed One was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: When he arrived, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's two feet and sat to one side.
