analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he sat to one side, he said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa btsun mo phreng ldan ma bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: btsun pa btsun mo phreng ldan ma bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Venerable One, Queen Mālādhara bows her head at the Blessed One's two feet.

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang khyod bde bar gyur cig /
translated: May Queen Mālādhara and you be well.

original: btsun pa btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i mchid nas 'phags pa 'di dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar bgyid pas rgyal po glo ba mi dga' bar sems na /
analyzed: btsun pa btsun mo phreng ldan ma'i mchid nas 'phags pa 'di dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar bgyid pas rgyal po glo ba mi dga' bar sems na /
translated: Venerable One, Queen Mālādhara says, 'Since these noble ones are playing in the water, the king is displeased.'

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis 'phags pa dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar mi 'gyur ba'i dran pa bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o //
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gis 'phags pa dag chab la phyar g-yeng gis rtse bar mi 'gyur ba'i dran pa bgyi ba cung zhig bca' ba mdzad na legs so zhes mchi'o //
translated: “Oh, it would be good if the Blessed One would make some kind of rule so that the noble ones would not play in the water like this.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mi de la cang mi gsung bas gnang ngo //
translated: The Blessed One assented to the man by remaining silent.

original: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas mi des bcom ldan 'das kyis cang mi gsung bas gnang bar rig nas /
translated: Then the man, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: bowed low until his forehead touched the Blessed One’s feet,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //
translated: and then he departed from the Blessed One’s presence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byung ba 'di dang gleng gzhi 'di dang skabs 'di la dge slong gi dge 'dun bsdu ba mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, because of this incident, because of this cause, because of this situation, gathered the community of monks.

original: zhes bya ba @380b la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba @380b la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As it is said, “The Blessed One rebuked them, ‘Worthless man, this is not fitting …’ … ‘And, monks, this should not be done again.’”🔽The buddhas, the blessed ones, know but do not ask;

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni mkhyen bzhin du rmed pa mdzad pa ste /
translated: they know and ask but do not reprimand;

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bcu bdun sde dag la rmas pa /
translated: Translation: The Blessed Buddha asked the group of seventeen monks:🔽“Monks, is it true that you played in the water like children?”

original: dge slong dag khyed chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse ba bden nam /🔽btsun pa mad do //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed chu la phyar g-yeng gis rtse ba bden nam / btsun pa mad do //
translated: “Yes, it’s true, Bhadanta.”🔽The Blessed Buddha rebuked them, saying,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /
translated: “Foolish men, this is not fitting for my ascetic disciples,

original: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes rnam par smad pa mdzad do //
translated: it is not suitable, it is not proper, it is not worthy of an ascetic, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” Then the Blessed One, having rebuked them in many ways, addressed the monks, saying,

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Monks, I establish a training rule for the monks, seeing ten benefits: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of corruptions not yet arisen, for the removal of corruptions already arisen, for the comfort of those who have confidence, for the increase of those without confidence, for

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /🔽chu la rtse na ltung byed do //
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste / chu la rtse na ltung byed do //
translated: “My śrāvakas should recite this rule for training:🔽‘If a monk plays in water, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

original: chu la rtse na zhes bya ba ni chu la rtse ba'i bsam pas lus kyi las dang lus kyi spyod pa dang / lus kyi g-yo ba byed na'o //
analyzed: chu la rtse na zhes bya ba ni chu la rtse ba'i bsam pas lus kyi las dang lus kyi spyod pa dang / lus kyi g-yo ba byed na'o //
translated: If a monk, with a thought of play, makes physical actions, physical behavior, or physical movements in water,

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags ngan song dang ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba dag tu sreg par byed /
translated: ‘Offense entailing confession’ means that, due to that unwholesome action, one will be reborn in the hells, as an animal, or in the realm of the hungry ghosts.

original: 'tshod par byed /
analyzed: 'tshod par byed /
translated: One will be burned,

original: ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: boiled, and fall.

original: gzhan yag ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste /🔽des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yag ji srid du ltung ba de ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags na dge ba'i chos rnams la sgrib par byed pa ste / des na ltung byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: As long as one does not confess that offense and does not reveal it, one will be obstructed from all the wholesome practices.

original: de la ltung @381a *//
analyzed: de la ltung @381a *//
translated: Therefore it is called an ‘offense entailing confession.’🔽What is an offense?

original: ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na gzhi dgu las te rtse bar bya'o //🔽rtser gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na gzhi dgu las te rtse bar bya'o // rtser gzhug par bya'o //
translated: It is an offense in relation to the nine bases.🔽One should play.

original: rtsed mo bya'o //
analyzed: rtsed mo bya'o //
translated: One should make others play.🔽One should play around.

original: rtsed mo byed du gzhug go /🔽dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsed mo byed du gzhug go / dga' bar bya'o //
translated: “I will play.”🔽“I will enjoy myself.”

original: dga' bar byed du gzhug go /🔽rgod bag bya'o //
analyzed: dga' bar byed du gzhug go / rgod bag bya'o //
translated: “I will make others enjoy themselves.”🔽“I will laugh.”

original: phyar g-yeng bya'o //
analyzed: phyar g-yeng bya'o //
translated: “I will splash.”

original: lus bsgyur bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: lus bsgyur bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: “I will move my body.”

original: de la ji ltar rtse bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar rtse bar bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas she na /
translated: “How will I play?”

original: dge slong gis chu la rtse ba'i bsam pas khri las ldang bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong gis chu la rtse ba'i bsam pas khri las ldang bar byed /
translated: If a monk, with the intention of playing in the water, gets up from his seat,

original: sham thabs gyon par byed /
analyzed: sham thabs gyon par byed /
translated: puts on his lower robe,

original: chos gos gyon par byed /
analyzed: chos gos gyon par byed /
translated: puts on his upper robe,

original: 'gro bar byed cing gos dag bzhag nas khrus ras gyon par byed /🔽chur 'jug par byed cing 'og tu nub par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed cing gos dag bzhag nas khrus ras gyon par byed / chur 'jug par byed cing 'og tu nub par byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: goes, puts aside his clothes, puts on his bathing robe,🔽enters the water, and submerges, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: steng du 'byung bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: steng du 'byung bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he comes up again, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sim par 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: sim par 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If he does it because he wants to cool off, there is no offense.

original: tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram nas pha rol gyi 'gram du 'gro bar byed na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he crosses from this side to the other side, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: pha rol gyi 'gram nas tshu rol gyi 'gram du 'ongs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram nas tshu rol gyi 'gram du 'ongs na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you go from the far shore to the near shore, you commit an offense.

original: rgal ba'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rgal ba'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you do so with the intention of crossing.

original: rgyun phyogs su rtsol na ltung byed du 'gyur ro; ;rgyun las ldog phyogs su rtsol na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs su rtsol na ltung byed du 'gyur ro; ;rgyun las ldog phyogs su rtsol na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you make an effort in the direction of the current, you commit an offense. If you make an effort in the direction opposite to the current, you commit an offense.

original: slob pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: slob pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if you do so with the intention of training.

original: chu la rnga bo che rdung ngam /
analyzed: chu la rnga bo che rdung ngam /
translated: If you beat the water with a drum,

original: chu la rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung ngam /
analyzed: chu la rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung ngam /
translated: beat the water with a single-sided clay drum,

original: chu la gseg ma 'khrab bam /
analyzed: chu la gseg ma 'khrab bam /
translated: beat the water with pebbles,

original: chu la khor yug byed dam /
analyzed: chu la khor yug byed dam /
translated: make a circle in the water,

original: chu la rdo rje byed dam /🔽chu la chu srubs 'dren na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu la rdo rje byed dam / chu la chu srubs 'dren na ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: make a vajra in the water,🔽or make a water wheel in the water, you commit an offense.

original: tha na chu la bem tol gyis brdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //🔽dge slong gis bum pa dang phru ba @381b dang ril ba dang kham phor du chu la rnga bo che rdung bar byed dam /
analyzed: tha na chu la bem tol gyis brdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro // dge slong gis bum pa dang phru ba @381b dang ril ba dang kham phor du chu la rnga bo che rdung bar byed dam /
translated: Even if you just hit the water with your palm, you commit an offense.🔽If a monk beats a drum in the water, beats a single-sided clay drum in the water,

original: chu la rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung bar byed dam /
analyzed: chu la rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung bar byed dam /
translated: Or do you beat a one-sided clay drum on water?🔽

original: tha na bem tol gyis rdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na bem tol gyis rdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one strikes with a lump of clay, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong gis sran tshod dang 'u sha dang thang tsha bar chu la rnga bo che rdung bar byed dam /
analyzed: dge slong gis sran tshod dang 'u sha dang thang tsha bar chu la rnga bo che rdung bar byed dam /
translated: If a monk strikes a water-filled bladder, a water-filled leather bag, or a water-filled wooden container,

original: rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung bar byed dam /
analyzed: rdza rnga kha gcig pa rdung bar byed dam /
translated: or if he strikes a one-sided clay drum,

original: tha na bem tol gyis rdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha na bem tol gyis rdeg na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he strikes with a lump of clay, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If he does so with the intention of making a sound, there is no offense.

original: grangs par 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med de de ltar rtse bar bya'o //🔽snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: grangs par 'dod pa'i bsam pas ni ltung ba med de de ltar rtse bar bya'o // snyam pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: He should play like this.🔽He should play like this.

original: rtser gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rtser gzhug go snyam pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the remaining intentions, such as “I will make them enter into play,” and so on.

original: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if he is a beginning practitioner, if he is insane, if his mind is disturbed, if he is the first offender.

original: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu bzhi pa rdzogs so ////🔽'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
analyzed: chu la rtse ba'i ltung byed de drug cu bzhi pa rdzogs so //// 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
translated: The fiftieth chapter on the offense entailing confession for playing in water is finished.

original: bam po re gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po re gcig pa /
translated: The Vinaya Verses

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems te bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag la phan🔽pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas shing rnam par grol ba'i bde ba nyams su myong ba'i tshe de 'di snyam du sems te bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag la phan pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: When the venerable Aniruddha, having abandoned all defilements, manifested arhatship and experienced the bliss of liberation, he thought, “The Blessed One has acted for my benefit,

original: bde bar gshegs pa de ni bdag la legs pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de ni bdag la legs pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: the Well-Gone One has acted for my good.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has removed my many painful things,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi bde ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi bde ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: the Blessed One has accomplished my many blissful things,

original: bcom @382a *// ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: bcom @382a *// ldan 'das de ni bdag gi sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos mang po sel bar mdzad pa /
translated: the Blessed One has dispelled my many sinful, unwholesome things,

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi dge ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni bdag gi dge ba'i chos mang po sgrub par mdzad pa yin na /
translated: “The Blessed One has accomplished so many virtuous qualities for me.

original: bdag gis de la ci zhig byas na /
analyzed: bdag gis de la ci zhig byas na /
translated: What can I do for him?🔽What can I do for the Blessed One in return,

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la lan byas pa dang / nye bar byas pa dang / rab tu byas par 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das la lan byas pa dang / nye bar byas pa dang / rab tu byas par 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: what can I do for him in repayment, what can I do for him in recompense?”

original: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thought further,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dka' ba mdzad pa brgya stong du ma dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dka' ba mdzad pa brgya stong du ma dag gis bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: “The Blessed Buddhas, having accomplished many hundreds of thousands of austerities, having completed the six perfections over three incalculable eons,

original: bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir yin pas bdag gis kyang gdul ba'i bya ba cung zhig bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa thugs su chud pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni sems can gyi don gyi phyir yin pas bdag gis kyang gdul ba'i bya ba cung zhig bya'o snyam mo //
translated: and having attained unsurpassed knowledge, all of that is for the sake of sentient beings. I too should do something to guide them.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa phye ma bred nang du yang dag 'jog las langs nas /
translated: Then the Venerable Aniruddha, having risen from his seclusion in the morning,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the Blessed One and,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: having arrived, bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and sat to one side.

original: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having sat to one side, the venerable Aniruddha said this to the Blessed One:

original: btsun pa bdag ljongs rgyur mchi bar 'tshal lo //
analyzed: btsun pa bdag ljongs rgyur mchi bar 'tshal lo //
translated: “Lord, I wish to go on a journey.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i sems thugs kyis mkhyen nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing in his mind the thoughts of the venerable Aniruddha,

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa /
translated: said this to the venerable Aniruddha:

original: ma 'gags pa khyod song la sems can ma rgal ba @382b rnams ni sgrol cig /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa khyod song la sems can ma rgal ba @382b rnams ni sgrol cig /
translated: “Aniruddha, go, and liberate those beings who have not been liberated,

original: ma grol ba rnams ni khrol cig /
analyzed: ma grol ba rnams ni khrol cig /
translated: free those who have not been freed,

original: dbugs ma byin pa rnams ni dbugs phyung zhig /
analyzed: dbugs ma byin pa rnams ni dbugs phyung zhig /
translated: give breath to those who have not been given breath,

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las zlos shig /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las zlos shig /
translated: and bring to complete nirvāṇa those who have not attained complete nirvāṇa.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba byas te /
translated: Then, the Venerable Aniruddha rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One’s words.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga nas song ngo // de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa de nyid kyi mtshan mo 'das nas snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: He bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and left the Blessed One’s presence.🔽Then, the Venerable Aniruddha, having passed the night, in the morning put on his lower robe and upper robe,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te mnyan yod du bsod snyoms la zhugs so //
translated: took his alms bowl, and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te /🔽phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas ji ltar longs spyod pa'i gnas mal mkhos su phab nas /
analyzed: mnyan yod du bsod snyoms brgyus nas zas kyi bya ba byas te / phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pas ji ltar longs spyod pa'i gnas mal mkhos su phab nas /
translated: Having gone for alms in Śrāvastī, after his meal,🔽he returned from his alms round. He put away his bedding and seat,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos thogs te ljongs rgyur song ngo //
translated: took his alms bowl and robe, and set out to wander through the country.

original: ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
analyzed: ri brags shig na khyim bdag cig 'dug pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs nas de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /
translated: In a certain mountain village there lived a householder who took a wife of equal caste. He played with her,

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: In a certain mountain village there lived a householder who took a wife from a family of equal status. He enjoyed himself with her,

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: and they coupled.

original: de la bu gnyis dang bu mo gcig yod nas des bu de gnyis kyi khyim phub cing bu mo de yang bag mar btang ngo //
analyzed: de la bu gnyis dang bu mo gcig yod nas des bu de gnyis kyi khyim phub cing bu mo de yang bag mar btang ngo //
translated: He had two sons and a daughter. He built houses for his sons and gave his daughter in marriage.

original: dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de yang dus la bab /🔽de'i bu mo de yang khyo shi bar gyur nas /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na khyim bdag de yang dus la bab / de'i bu mo de yang khyo shi bar gyur nas /
translated: Later, the householder died.

original: ming po gnyis kyi khyim du gnas par brtsams shing de skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
analyzed: ming po gnyis kyi khyim du gnas par brtsams shing de skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do //
translated: His daughter became a widow and went to live in the houses of her two brothers. She began to have sex with other men.

original: ri brags de na de'i ming po de gnyis gtso bor grags pa yin te /🔽gang gi tshe de @383a *//
analyzed: ri brags de na de'i ming po de gnyis gtso bor grags pa yin te / gang gi tshe de @383a *//
translated: In that mountain village, those two brothers were known as the chief men.

original: gnyis 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'thab pa de'i tshe na 'thab zla de na re /
analyzed: gnyis 'ga' zhig dang lhan cig 'thab pa de'i tshe na 'thab zla de na re /
translated: Whenever they fought with someone, the other person would say,

original: khyed gnyis kyang smra'am /
analyzed: khyed gnyis kyang smra'am /
translated: “Do you two even talk?

original: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo skyes pa gzhan dag dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: “Your sister is having sex with other men.”

original: de gnyis dong ste sring mo la smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis dong ste sring mo la smras pa /
translated: The two of them went to their sister and said,

original: sring mo kho bo cag gnyis mi dang 'thab pa na /
analyzed: sring mo kho bo cag gnyis mi dang 'thab pa na /
translated: “Sister, when we were fighting with men,

original: de na re khyed gnyis kyang smra'am /
analyzed: de na re khyed gnyis kyang smra'am /
translated: they said, ‘You two talk too much.🔽Your sister is having sex with other men.’

original: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo skyes pa gzhan dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes zer ro //🔽sring mos smras pa /
analyzed: khyed gnyis kyi sring mo skyes pa gzhan dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod par byed do zhes zer ro // sring mos smras pa /
translated: ”🔽“Brother, I am a woman of virtue,

original: ming po gnyis bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa lags na skye bo rdzun ma dag bdag la skur bar mchi'o //
analyzed: ming po gnyis bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa lags na skye bo rdzun ma dag bdag la skur bar mchi'o //
translated: but those liars are slandering me.”

original: dus gzhan zhig na de la sems can zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na de la sems can zhugs par gyur te /
translated: Later, she became pregnant,

original: mngal na gnas pa'i mtshan ma dag kyang byung nas ming po gnyis kyis de la smras pa /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i mtshan ma dag kyang byung nas ming po gnyis kyis de la smras pa /
translated: and when the signs of pregnancy appeared, her two brothers said to her,

original: sring mo khyod na re /
analyzed: sring mo khyod na re /
translated: “Sister, you said,

original: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa lags na /
analyzed: bdag ni tshul khrims dang ldan pa lags na /
translated: ‘I am a woman of virtue,

original: skye bo rdzun ma dag skur bar mchi'o zhes zer na 'di ga las byung /
analyzed: skye bo rdzun ma dag skur bar mchi'o zhes zer na 'di ga las byung /
translated: “Where did you get this lie that a fake person is slandering us?”

original: sring mos smras pa /
analyzed: sring mos smras pa /
translated: His sister said,

original: ming po gnyis 'di ni sems can spyi rdol can zhig nan gyis bdag gi mngal du zhugs pa lags so //
analyzed: ming po gnyis 'di ni sems can spyi rdol can zhig nan gyis bdag gi mngal du zhugs pa lags so //
translated: “Brothers, this is a sentient being who is a chatterbox. He insisted on entering my womb.”🔽Later, when he was born, his relatives gathered and came together, and they said, “What name should we give this boy?”

original: dus gzhan zhig na de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas de'i nye du dag 'dus shing lhags te khye'u 'di'i ming cir gdags zhes de'i ming 'dogs par byed pa na de dag 'di snyam du sems te khye'u 'di ma btsas pa kho na nas mas spyi rdol
analyzed: dus gzhan zhig na de btsas pa las khye'u zhig byung nas de'i nye du dag 'dus shing lhags te khye'u 'di'i ming cir gdags zhes de'i ming 'dogs par byed pa na de dag 'di snyam du sems te khye'u 'di ma btsas pa kho na nas mas spyi rdol
translated: They thought, “This boy’s mother was a chatterbox even before he was born.

original: can zhes bya ba'i tshig kun tu brjod pas /
analyzed: can zhes bya ba'i tshig kun tu brjod pas /
translated: She constantly used the word ‘chatterbox.’🔽Let’s name this boy ‘Chatterbox.’”

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa'i mdun du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'khod pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas de dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang rang bzhin khong du chud nas 'di ltar de dag gis stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes @388b bcom ste /
translated: and listened to the Dharma in front of the venerable Aniruddha. The venerable Aniruddha understood their thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature, and with the vajra of wisdom he leveled the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa de ltar chos bstan par byas so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa de ltar chos bstan par byas so //
translated: He manifested the fruit of stream-entry and taught the Dharma to them.

original: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bden pa mthong nas smras pa /
translated: After they saw the truths, they said,

original: btsun pa bdag cag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsun pa la brten nas /🔽btsun pas bdag cag la gang mdzad pa 'di lta bu ni bdag cag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsun pa la brten nas / btsun pas bdag cag la gang mdzad pa 'di lta bu ni bdag cag la phas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: “Venerable, we have relied on you as a spiritual friend.🔽What you have done for us, no one else could have done,🔽not our fathers,

original: mas kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: mas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not our mothers,

original: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not the king,

original: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not the gods,

original: sngon gyi pha mes dag gis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: sngon gyi pha mes dag gis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not our ancestors,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze dag gis kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze dag gis kyang ma bgyis /
translated: not ascetics or brahmins,

original: byams pa dang mdza' bshes dang / rtsa lag gi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis te /
analyzed: byams pa dang mdza' bshes dang / rtsa lag gi tshogs kyis kyang ma bgyis te /
translated: not our friends, relatives, or kinsmen.

original: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho ni bskams /
analyzed: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho ni bskams /
translated: You have dried up the ocean of blood and tears,

original: rus pa'i ri dag las ni bsgral /🔽ngan song gi sgo dag ni bkum /
analyzed: rus pa'i ri dag las ni bsgral / ngan song gi sgo dag ni bkum /
translated: liberated us from the mountains of bones,🔽closed the doors to the lower realms,

original: mtho ris dang thar pa'i sgo dag ni phye /
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i sgo dag ni phye /
translated: and opened the doors to the higher realms and liberation.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags nas ni rkang pa phyung /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang dud 'gro dang yi dvags nas ni rkang pa phyung /
translated: They were pulled out from the hells, animals, and hungry ghosts,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du ni bzhag /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du ni bzhag /
translated: and placed among the gods and humans.

original: 'khor ba ni mthar bgyis /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni mthar bgyis /
translated: They reached the end of saṃsāra.

original: thog ma ma mchis pa'i dus nas bsags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
analyzed: thog ma ma mchis pa'i dus nas bsags pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: With the vajra of wisdom they destroyed the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection that had been accumulated since beginningless time,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni thob ste /🔽btsun pa bdag cag ni mngon par zhugs pa lags so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni thob ste / btsun pa bdag cag ni mngon par zhugs pa lags so //
translated: and they attained the fruit of stream-entry.🔽“We have entered, Venerable One!

original: btsun pa bdag cag ni mngon par zhugs pa lags te /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag ni mngon par zhugs pa lags te /
translated: We have entered, Venerable One!

original: btsun pa bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dang chos dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchis /
analyzed: btsun pa bdag cag bcom ldan 'das dang chos dang dge slong gi dge 'dun la skyabs su mchis /
translated: Venerable One, we go for refuge to the Blessed One, to the Dharma, and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: bdag cag dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
analyzed: bdag cag dge bsnyen du gzung du gsol /
translated: Please accept us as lay followers.

original: deng slan chad ji srid 'tsho'i bar du glo ba thag pas nas rab tu dang bas skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: deng slan chad ji srid 'tsho'i bar du glo ba thag pas nas rab tu dang bas skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: From this day forth for as long as we live, with full conviction we go for refuge.”

original: 'phags @389a *// pa bdag cag gis da ni gzhan gyi til gyi phub ma tsam yang ma byin par len pa'i rdo mi thogs pas rdzas 'dis ci bgyi /
analyzed: 'phags @389a *// pa bdag cag gis da ni gzhan gyi til gyi phub ma tsam yang ma byin par len pa'i rdo mi thogs pas rdzas 'dis ci bgyi /
translated: “Noble ones, we will not be able to carry a stone even the size of a sesame seed without having given it away, so what should we do with this wealth?”

original: bzhin bzang dag de nyid du deng la zhog cig /
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag de nyid du deng la zhog cig /
translated: “Good people, go back and leave it there.”

original: 'phags pa bdag cag 'dzin pa mi mchi'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa bdag cag 'dzin pa mi mchi'am /
translated: “Noble ones, will we not be arrested?”

original: ci khyed kyis der khyi gcig tsam yang sad par gyur tam /
analyzed: ci khyed kyis der khyi gcig tsam yang sad par gyur tam /
translated: “Did you wake up even one dog there?”

original: deng la de nyid du zhog cig /
analyzed: deng la de nyid du zhog cig /
translated: “Go back and leave it there.”

original: de dag gis der song ste rdzas de dag phyir bzhag go /
analyzed: de dag gis der song ste rdzas de dag phyir bzhag go /
translated: They went back and left the wealth there.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha gang yin pa des /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la mngon par dad pa'i lha gang yin pa des /
translated: Then the gods who had faith in Venerable Aniruddha

original: ri brags der smras pa /
analyzed: ri brags der smras pa /
translated: said to the people of the town,

original: khyed ma bcom pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i mthu yin te; 'phags pa ma 'gags pa skyed mos tshal 'di na bzhugs kyi /
analyzed: khyed ma bcom pa gang yin pa de thams cad ni 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i mthu yin te; 'phags pa ma 'gags pa skyed mos tshal 'di na bzhugs kyi /
translated: “Everything that was not destroyed was the power of the noble Aniruddha. The noble Aniruddha is staying in this park,

original: deng la chos nyon cig /
analyzed: deng la chos nyon cig /
translated: so go and listen to the Dharma.”

original: de nas srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
analyzed: de nas srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma dag kha cig ni ltad mo skyes pa na /
translated: Then, many hundreds of thousands of living beings, some out of curiosity,

original: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na /
analyzed: kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag gis bskul ba na /
translated: and some urged on by their previous roots of virtue,

original: de nas phyir 'thon nas 'phags pa ma 'gags pa ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas phyir 'thon nas 'phags pa ma 'gags pa ga la ba der dong ste phyin nas /
translated: came out and went to where the noble Aniruddha was.

original: 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Having arrived, they bowed their heads at the feet of the noble Aniruddha,

original: chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i mdun du 'khod do //
analyzed: chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'phags pa ma 'gags pa'i mdun du 'khod do //
translated: and sat down in front of the noble Aniruddha in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'khor de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang rang bzhin khong du chud nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'khor de'i bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang rang bzhin khong du chud nas /
translated: The Venerable Aniruddha, understanding the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of that assembly,🔽taught them the Dharma accordingly.

original: 'di ltar srog chags khri nyis stong gis stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar srog chags khri nyis stong gis stan de nyid la 'dug bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu mtho ba ye shes kyi rdo rjes bcom ste /
translated: In this way, twelve thousand living beings, while sitting on those very seats, with the vajra of wisdom destroyed the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the view of the transitory collection,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon @389b sum du byas pa dang / kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon @389b sum du byas pa dang / kha cig gis ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
translated: some the result of once-returner,

original: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu /
translated: some the result of nonreturner,

original: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rab tu byung ste nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
translated: some went forth and actualized the state of an arhat through the elimination of all defilements,

original: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed /🔽kha cig gis ni rang byang chub tu sems bskyed /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni nyan thos kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed / kha cig gis ni rang byang chub tu sems bskyed /
translated: some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a śrāvaka,🔽some generated the intention to achieve the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ltar chos bstan par byas te /
translated: and some generated the intention to achieve unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par gyur to; ;de nas rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: 'khor de las phal cher sangs rgyas la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / dge 'dun la bab par gyur to; ;de nas rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag gis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the five hundred sons of noble family said to the venerable Aniruddha,

original: btsun pa ma 'gags pa bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po thob na bdag cag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: btsun pa ma 'gags pa bdag cag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po thob na bdag cag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar tshangs par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: “Venerable Aniruddha, if we may go forth in the Dharma and Vinaya so well spoken, complete our novitiate, and achieve full ordination, then we too will practice the holy life in the Blessed One’s presence.”

original: bzhin bzang dag tshur sheg dang bcom ldan 'das kyis khyed rab tu 'byin pa dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhin bzang dag tshur sheg dang bcom ldan 'das kyis khyed rab tu 'byin pa dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'thob par mdzad par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Come, sirs! The Blessed One will give you the going forth, complete your novitiate, and confer on you full ordination.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag khrid nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po de dag khrid nas bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: Then the venerable Aniruddha took the five hundred sons of noble family and went to the Blessed One.

original: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun na bzhugs shing chos ston par mdzad do //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa thag ring po kho na @390a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe na bcom ldan 'das 'khor brgya phrag du ma'i mdun na bzhugs shing chos ston par mdzad do // bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa thag ring po kho na @390a *//
translated: At that time, the Blessed One was seated in front of a retinue of many hundreds, teaching the Dharma.

original: nas gzigs so //
analyzed: nas gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw Venerable Aniruddha from a distance.🔽Having seen him, he addressed the monks, saying,

original: gzigs nas kyang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong ma 'gags pa thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba mthong ngam /
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag khyed kyis dge slong ma 'gags pa thag ring po kho na nas 'ong ba mthong ngam /
translated: Monks, do you see the monk Aniruddha coming from a distance?

original: btsun pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: btsun pa mthong ngo //
translated: Venerable One, we see him.

original: dge slong dag ma 'gags pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes dang bcas shing 'ong ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag ma 'gags pa 'di de bzhin gshegs pa la skyes dang bcas shing 'ong ste /
translated: Monks, this Aniruddha comes to the Thus-Gone One with a question.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes ni 'di ltar 'dul ba las gzhan pa de lta bu med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes ni 'di ltar 'dul ba las gzhan pa de lta bu med do //
translated: The Thus-Gone One's question is not like that of others who are disciplined.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then Venerable Aniruddha went to where the Blessed One was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go ;mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go ;mtha' gcig tu 'dug nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: When he had sat to one side, the venerable Aniruddha said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po 'di dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'tshal na /
analyzed: btsun pa rigs kyi bu lnga brgya po 'di dag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po 'tshal na /
translated: “Lord, these five hundred sons of noble families wish to go forth and be fully ordained in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag rab tu dbyung du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba'i slad du 'di dag rab tu dbyung du gsol /
translated: Blessed One, out of compassion for them, please let them go forth.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad du gsol /
translated: Please let them be fully ordained.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la dge slong tshur shog /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la dge slong tshur shog /
translated: The Blessed One said to them, “Monks, come forth!

original: rab tu byung zhig /
analyzed: rab tu byung zhig /
translated: Go forth!

original: dge slong dag tshur shog /
analyzed: dge slong dag tshur shog /
translated: Monks, come here!🔽Live the holy life.”

original: tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'i mjug kho nar skra byi ba dang snam sbyar gyon par gyur te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyad pa spyod cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi bka'i mjug kho nar skra byi ba dang snam sbyar gyon par gyur te /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One had said this, their hair and beards fell out and they were clad in robes.

original: skra dang kha spu zhag bdun skyes pa tsam dang lag pa lhung bzed dang / bya ma bum gyis brel ba dang / dge @390b slong rdzogs par bsnyen nas lo brgya lon pa'i spyod lam lta bur gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: skra dang kha spu zhag bdun skyes pa tsam dang lag pa lhung bzed dang / bya ma bum gyis brel ba dang / dge @390b slong rdzogs par bsnyen nas lo brgya lon pa'i spyod lam lta bur gnas par gyur to //
translated: Their hair and beards grew to a length of three inches, and they held their alms bowls and water jars in their hands. They were dressed in the robes of monks, and they behaved as if they had been fully ordained for one hundred years.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: They said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur shog bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas tshur shog bka' stsal pa //
translated: “The Tathāgata said to us, ‘Come forth!’

original: skra byi snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus ldan zhing //
analyzed: skra byi snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus ldan zhing //
translated: Our hair fell out and we were clothed in robes.

original: mod la dbang po rab zhi gnas gyur te //
analyzed: mod la dbang po rab zhi gnas gyur te //
translated: Our senses were immediately calmed and pacified.

original: sangs rgyas dgongs pas lus gzugs bkab par gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dgongs pas lus gzugs bkab par gyur //
translated: The Buddha’s intention was that our bodies be covered with robes.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gdams ngag stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de dag la gdams ngag stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavān gave them instructions:

original: gcig pu dben pa bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pa bdag nyid btang bar gnas pa na rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig dag bgos nas /
analyzed: gcig pu dben pa bag yod pa brtun pa dang ldan pa bdag nyid btang bar gnas pa na rigs kyi bu dag gang gi phyir skra dang kha spu bregs te gos ngur smrig dag bgos nas /
translated: “Noble sons, when you live alone, in isolation, with carefulness, with diligence, and with self-control, then you should shave off your hair and beard, put on the orange robes, and leave home for homelessness.

original: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung bar byed pa tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' bla na med pa /
translated: with perfect faith they go forth from home to homelessness,🔽and in this very life they manifest and make real with their own supernormal powers the unexcelled holy life,

original: de'i tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye bzad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe de nyid la rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye bzad do //
translated: and they understand: ‘Birth is exhausted for me,

original: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: the holy life has been lived,

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: what had to be done has been done,🔽there is no more of this or that state.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed cing dgra bcom pa khams gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: ’ They are arhats free from attachment to the three realms,

original: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bong ba dang gser du mnyam pa nam mkha' dang lag mthil du mtshungs pa'i sems dang ldan pa /
translated: with minds as unconcerned as space or the palm of the hand,

original: tsan dan bzhag pa lta bu rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
analyzed: tsan dan bzhag pa lta bu rig pas sgo nga'i sbubs dral bar gyur cing /
translated: like a piece of wood that has been set down.

original: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang mngon par shes pa dang so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa /
translated: They have attained knowledge, supernormal powers, and discriminations,

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la rgyab kyis phyogs pa /
translated: and they turn their backs on the acquisitions, desires, and honors of this world.

original: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / brjed par bya ba dang / mngon @391a *//🔽du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po dang nye dbang dang bcas pa'i lha rnams kyis mchod par bya ba dang / brjed par bya ba dang / mngon @391a *// du smra bar bya bar gyur to //
translated: He became worthy of offerings, of praise, and of homage from the gods, including Indra and Upendra.

original: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pa la dris pa /
translated: The monks asked the Venerable Aniruddha,

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no; ;nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di

analyzed: de gnyis phyag dar khrod khyer te rdzing bu rdo rtsigs can du dong nas /

analyzed: de gnyis kyis phyag dar khrod der 'khrur bcug nas nyi ma la bting ste 'khod do //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sa las skyes de'i tshe na ni yang dag pa ma yin pas yin gyi /

analyzed: da ni yang dag pas yin te /
translated: but now it is true.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lan du zhes bya ba ni skra dag dang de dang 'brel ba'i gos yin no zhes ma gsungs sam /

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di la brdzun du smra ba ga la yod kyi /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di la brdzun du smra ba ga la yod kyi /
translated: “Venerable, how can he lie?

analyzed: tshur shog 'dong la dge slong rnams la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Come, let’s go and tell the monks.”

analyzed: sa las skyes de mdza' bos bslus pa na btub par gyur nas de gnyis gtsug lag khang du dong ste /
translated: When Pūrana was deceived by Mātṛceṭa, he became angry. The two of them went to the monastery

original: dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: and said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /

translated: “Venerables, we have seen the elder Upāli and the nun Utpalavarṇā together, touching each other with their bodies.”🔽“Venerables, should we go because of our faith in one of them

original: yid ches pas 'gro bar bya /
analyzed: yid ches pas 'gro bar bya /
translated: or because of our trust in the other?”🔽The monks said,

analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa / tshe dang ldan pa gnyis ci / khyed gnyis lha dang mi rnams gcig tu yongs su btang zhing sems can dmyal ba dang yi dvags dang dud 'gro rnams su gcig tu gnas sam ci na dge slong dgra bcom pa rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan pa mi'i chos bla ma'i rdzu 'phrul gyi
translated: “Venerables, what is this?🔽Have you abandoned gods and humans to live among hell beings, hungry ghosts, and animals?

original: cho 'phrul rnam par ston pa de la khyed gnyis gzhi med pa'i dge 'dun @409a *//🔽lhag ma'i chos kyis skur ba 'debs par byed /
analyzed: cho 'phrul rnam par ston pa de la khyed gnyis gzhi med pa'i dge 'dun @409a *// lhag ma'i chos kyis skur ba 'debs par byed /
translated: You are slandering an arhat monk who has attained the eight liberations, who is absorbed in concentration, who displays the higher knowledge of a human being, and who has attained the higher knowledge of the destruction of the defilements with a charge of a pārājika offense for no reason at all.”🔽“Venerables, we have seen the elder Upāli and the nun Utpalavarṇā together, touching each other with their bodies.”

original: de gnyis kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis smras pa /

translated: How is it that one does not commit an offense due to six bases?

analyzed: des ma mthong ba dang ma thos pa dang mi dogs pa la des 'du shes ma bsgyur cing bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang blo gros dang rtog pa dang lta ba ma bsgyur bar 'di skad ces bdag gis mthong ngo //
translated: If one says, “I saw it,” “I heard it,” or “I suspected it,” when one has not seen, heard or suspected it, but one does not change one’s perception, acquiescence, desire, understanding, thought or view, then one does not commit an offense.🔽If one sees it, but forgets it,

analyzed: thos so // dogs so zhes zer na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if one hears it, but forgets it,🔽or if one suspects it, but forgets it,🔽and then says, “I saw it,”

original: de mthong la de yang brjed pa dang / des thos la de yang brjed pa dang / des dogs la de yang brjed pa la /
analyzed: de mthong la de yang brjed pa dang / des thos la de yang brjed pa dang / des dogs la de yang brjed pa la /
translated: “I heard it,” or “I suspected it,”🔽then one does not commit an offense.

original: des 'du shes ma bsgyur cing bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang blo gros dang / rtog pa dang / lta ba ma bsgyur bar 'di skad ces bdag gis mthong ste de yang ma brjed do //
analyzed: des 'du shes ma bsgyur cing bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang blo gros dang / rtog pa dang / lta ba ma bsgyur bar 'di skad ces bdag gis mthong ste de yang ma brjed do //
translated: If he does not change his perception, but changes his acceptance, desire, intention, thought, or view, and then says, “I see it, and I do not forget it,”

original: bdag gis thos te de yang ma brjed do //
analyzed: bdag gis thos te de yang ma brjed do //
translated: “I hear it, and I do not forget it,”🔽“I suspect it, and I do not forget it,” then he does not commit an offense.

original: bdag dogs te de yang ma brjed do zhes zer na ltung bar mi 'gyur te de ltar gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dogs te de yang ma brjed do zhes zer na ltung bar mi 'gyur te de ltar gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, there are six bases for not committing an offense.

original: ji ltar gang zag ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs pa la gzhi bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur la gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gang @412a *//
analyzed: ji ltar gang zag ma dag pa la skur pa 'debs pa la gzhi bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur la gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du gang @412a *//
translated: Just as there are eleven bases for committing an offense when slandering an impure person, and six bases for not committing an offense,

analyzed: zag ma dag pa dag pa ltar bcos pa la skur pa 'debs pa la yang gzhi bcu gcig gis ltung bar 'gyur la /

original: gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi drug gis ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and six bases for not committing an offense.

original: dril bsgrags pa la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dril bsgrags pa la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the slander is spoken in jest.

original: ngos la ri mor bris pa phan chad la yang ltung ba med de /
analyzed: ngos la ri mor bris pa phan chad la yang ltung ba med de /
translated: There is no offense if the slander is written on a wall or drawn on a piece of paper.

analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis shes pa bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad kyis kyang shes so //
translated: “Just as I know, so does the whole world know.”

original: snyam na'o // las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: snyam na'o // las dang po ba dang / smyos pa dang sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor ba dag gis nyen pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if the monk is a beginning practitioner, or is insane, or is the first offender.🔽The sixty-ninth downfall.

translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī,
